info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 02 at 4:58PM PDT until September 02 at 5:15PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM PDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN MARION COUNTY... At 458 PM PDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Silver Falls, or 15 miles east of Salem, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Stayton, Silver Falls, Mehama, Aumsville, and Sublimity. In Oregon this includes State Highway 22 east of Salem between mile markers 9 and 17, and between mile markers 22 and 24. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
